titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Edvardas Turauskas Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-10-16T12:05-0700

change.item: October 2013 added microfilm reel notes November 2012 revised for microfilming. July 30, 2012 Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden. March 23, 2004: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Edvardas Turauskas Papers)//EN" "turauske.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, printed matter, clippings, and photographs, relating to the Soviet occupation of Lithuania, 1940-1941, and Lithuanian foreign relations in Europe, 1934-1941. Also available on microfilm (14 reels).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Edvardas Turauskas Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1975.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Adriejavas, Lithuania
Elected member of the First Committee of Catholic Action
Entered the service of the Press Office of the Prime Minister
Member of the Lithuanian Diplomatic Mission to Berne
Secretary of the Lithuanian Legation in Berne
Chargé d'Affaires of the Lithuanian Legation in Berne
LL. D., University of Paris (grant from the Lithuanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs)
Elected member to the Lithuanian Judicial Commission and Ministry of Foreign Affairs
Editor-in-chief of the Catholic Lithuanian magazine Rytas
President of the Lithuanian-French Society in Kaunas
Author, Chretienneté et Nationalité
Director of the section specializing in foreign affairs of the Lithuanian Telegraph Agency Elta
Author, Les Fondements du Droit
Author, Buts et Structure de la S. D. N.
Author, Agences Telegraphiques et Bureaux de Presse
Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary of Lithuania to Prague, Belgrade, and Bucharest
Author, Souveraineté de l'Eglise et de l'Etat
Political Director of the Lithuanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs
Founding member of the Catholic Lithuanian daily magazine Zydinis
Permanent Lithuanian Delegate to the League of Nations
Author, Le Sort des Pays Baltes
Plenipotentiary for Switzerland of the Lithuanian Relief Fund of America

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

did.unittitle: Lithuanian Legation in Washington, D. C.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, minutes of meetings, lists, charts, notes, printed matter, and clippings, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Ancewicz, Francizek, Stalin's State Theory on the Basis of Development of the USSR (in Polish),
History's Forger - A Historical Rectification (in German),
Klimas, P., Lithuanian National History (in Lithuanian),
Konce, A., report on repatriated Lithuanians (in Lithuanian),
Memorandum on the sovietization of Lithuania, first stage (in Lithuanian),
List of Lithuanians arrested or deported
Lithuanian Committee of Liberation, (VLIK - Vyriausias Lietuvos Islaisvinimo Komitetas),
Lithuanian Consulate in Klaipeda, Bulletin, No. 9,
Correspondence with the Lithuanian Foreign Office in Kaunas regarding the Jewish population in newly detached provinces, formerly Poland,
Memorandum on postwar Russian emigration (in Lithuanian),
Lithuanian Legations in Berlin, Berne, and Rome (bound)
Reminiscences dictated by Princesse Radvila (in French),
Recollections of the Lithuanian interpreter in the Soviet occupied zone of Berlin, deported to the USSR (in Lithuanian),
Memorandum regarding past and possible future Latvias (in German),
Memorandum regarding the reinstatement of Lithuania's national autonomy (in German),
Recollections of the first days of Lithuanian political emigres in Germany and Switzerland (in Lithuanian),
Resignation from the post of President of Lithuania in July 1940,
Soviet Russia Occupation of Lithuania (in Lithuanian),
Suduvis, N. E., On That Side of the Iron Curtain - Lithuania (in Lithuanian),
Voldemars, Augustinas, The Catholic Church in the Province of Vilna (in French),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, handwritten and typewritten manuscripts, and lectures, by Edvardas Turauskas, arranged alphabetically by title or subject.

did.unittitle: Articles written for Lithuanian magazines, Zidinys and Politika (in Lithuanian),
Letters to the Communist Brothers (in Lithuanian),
Voice of America, manuscripts and drafts for,
42 prints / 1 envelope. 40 photographs depicting atrocities committed by Soviet forces in Lithuania. Included are 2 photographs of Aniceta Stoucinte.
